summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 6992, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Madison Street from the easterly end of the Madison Street Bridge (said point being about five hundred and fifty feet southwesterly along the center line of said East Madison Street, from its intersection with the line between sections 27 and 28 in township 25 north, Range 4 east) to the east margin of Laurel Shade Avenue, by macadamizing, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and ordinance number 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
